classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: Drawing from your innate magic, you can cast spells. The information below details how you use those rules with Sorcerer spells, which appear in the {@filter Sorcerer spell list|spells|class=sorcerer (Ishiir)|source=Ishiir}.

entries.name: Cantrips.
entries: You know four Sorcerer cantrips of your choice from the {@filter Sorcerer spell list|spells|class=summoner (Ishiir)|source=Ishiir|level=0}.
Whenever you gain a Sorcerer level, you can replace one of your cantrips from this feature with another Sorcerer cantrip of your choice.
When you reach Sorcerer levels 4 and 10, you learn another Sorcerer cantrip of your choice, as shown in the Cantrips column of the Sorcerer Features table.

entries.name: Spell Slots.
entries: The Sorcerer Features table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your level 1+ spells. You regain all expended slots when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

entries.name: Prepared Spells of Level 1+.
entries: You prepare the list of level 1+ spells that are available for you to cast with this feature. To start, choose two level 1 {@filter Sorcerer spells|spells|class=sorcerer (Ishiir)|source=Ishiir}.

The number of spells on your list increases as you gain Sorcerer levels, as shown in the Prepared Spells column of the Sorcerer Features table. Whenever that number increases, choose additional Sorcerer spells until the number of spells on your list matches the number in the Sorcerer Features table. The chosen spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For example, if you're a level 3 Sorcerer, your list of prepared spells can include six Sorcerer spells of level 1 or 2 in any combination.

If another Sorcerer feature gives you spells that you always have prepared, those spells don't count against the number of spells you can prepare with this feature, but those spells otherwise count as Sorcerer spells for you.

entries.name: Changing Your Prepared Spells.
entries: Whenever you gain a Sorcerer level, you can replace one spell on your list with another Sorcerer spell for which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability.
entries: Charisma is your spellcasting ability for your Sorcerer spells.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use an {@item Arcane Focus|PHB} as a Spellcasting Focus for your Sorcerer spells.

classFeature.name: Spell Versatility
entries: Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, you can replace one spell you learned from this Spellcasting feature with another spell from the sorcerer spell list. The new spell must be the same level as the spell you replace.

classFeature.name: Innate Sorcery
entries: An event in your past left an indelible mark on you, infusing you with simmering magic. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can unleash that magic for 1 minute, during which you gain the following benefits:

items: The spell save DC of your Sorcerer spells increases by 1.
You have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on the {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} of Sorcerer spells you cast.

entries: You can use this feature twice, and you regain all expended uses of it when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

classFeature.name: Flexible Casting
entries: You can use your sorcery points to gain additional spell slots, or sacrifice spell slots to gain additional sorcery points. You learn other ways to use your sorcery points as you reach higher levels.

entries.name: Creating Spell Slots
entries: You can transform unexpended sorcery points into one spell slot on your turn (no {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} required). The created spell slots vanish at the end of a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}. The Creating Spell Slots table shows the cost of creating a spell slot of a given level. You can create spell slots no higher in level than 5th.

entries.name: Converting a Spell Slot to Sorcery Points
entries: You can expend one spell slot and gain a number of sorcery points equal to the slot's level (no {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} required).

classFeature.name: Font of Magic
entries: You tap into a deep wellspring of magic within yourself. This wellspring is represented by sorcery points, which allow you to create a variety of magical effects.

classFeature.name: Sorcery Points
entries: You have 2 sorcery points, and you gain one additional point every time you level up, to a maximum of 20 at level 20. You can never have more sorcery points than shown on the table for your level. You regain all spent sorcery points when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

classFeature.name: Empowering Reserves
entries: When you make an {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir}, you can spend 1 sorcery points to gain {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on the check.

classFeature.name: Imbuing Touch
entries: As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can touch one nonmagical weapon and spend 2 sorcery points to imbue it with magic for 1 minute. For the duration, the weapon is considered magical for the purpose of overcoming {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir} and {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to nonmagical attacks.

For each additional 2 sorcery points you spend, you can give the weapon a +1 bonus to {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} and damage rolls (up to +3), stacking with existing bonuses on the weapon, up to a maximum of +5 for the {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} bonus.

classFeature.name: Sorcerous Fortitude
entries: As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can spend any number of sorcery points to roll a {@dice d4} for each point expended. You gain a number of temporary hit points equal to the total rolled + your Charisma modifier.

classFeature.name: Metamagic
entries: Because your magic flows from within, you can alter your spells to suit your needs; you gain two Metamagic options of your choice from the list below. You use the chosen options to temporarily modify spells you cast. To use an option, you must spend the number of Sorcery Points that it costs.
You can use only one Metamagic option on a spell when you cast it unless otherwise noted in one of those options.

When you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir} you can replace one metamagic you know with another one. You gain two more options at Sorcerer level 10 and two more at Sorcerer level 17.

classFeature.name: Sorcerous Origin
entries: Choose a sorcerous origin, which describes the source of your innate magical power, from the list of available origins.
Your choice grants you features when you choose it at 3rd level and again at 6th, 14th, and 18th level.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Proficiency Versatility
entries: When you gain the Ability Score Improvement feature from your class, you can also replace one of your skill proficiencies with a skill {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} offered by your class at 1st level (the {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} you replace needn't be from the class).
This change represents one of your skills atrophying as you focus on a different skill.

classFeature.name: Sorcerous Versatility
entries: Whenever you reach a level in this class that grants the Ability Score Improvement feature, you can do one of the following, representing the magic within you flowing in new ways:

items: Replace one of the options you chose for the Metamagic feature with a different {@filter Metamagic option|optionalfeatures|Feature Type=MM|source=Ishiir} available to you.
Replace one cantrip you learned from this class's Spellcasting feature with another cantrip from the {@filter sorcerer spell list|spells|level=0|class=Sorcerer (Ishiir)|source=Ishiir}.

classFeature.name: Sorcerous Origin feature
entries: You gain a feature granted by your Sorcerous Origin.

classFeature.name: Sorcery Incarnate
entries: If you have no uses of Innate Sorcery left, you can use it if you spend 2 Sorcery Points when you take the {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to activate it.
In addition, while your Innate Sorcery feature is active, you can use up to two of your {@filter Metamagic|optionalfeatures|Feature Type=MM|source=Ishiir} options on each spell you cast.
Additionally, you add your Charisma modifier to the damage you deal with any Sorcerer cantrip.

entries: When you cast a Sorcerer spell of 1st level or higher that deals damage, you add your Charisma modifier to one damage roll of the spell. If the level of the spell is higher than your Charisma modifier, you add it to the damage instead.
