classFeature.name: Arcane Apotheosis
entries: While your Innate Sorcery feature is active, you can use one Metamagic option on each of your turns without spending Sorcery Points on it and your Spell Save DC is increased by 2 rather than 1.

subclassFeature.name: Aberrant Mind
entries: An alien influence has wrapped its tendrils around your mind, giving you psionic power. You can now touch other minds with that power and alter the world around you by using it to control the magical energy of the multiverse. Will this power shine from you as a hopeful beacon to others? Or will you be a source of terror to those who feel the stab of your mind and witness the strange manifestations of your might?

As an Aberrant Mind sorcerer, you decide how you acquired your powers. Were you born with them? Or did an event later in life leave you shining with psionic awareness? Consult the Aberrant Origins table for a possible origin of your power.

entries.caption: Aberrant Origins
rows: You were exposed to the Far Realm's warping influence. You are convinced that a tentacle is now growing on you, but no one else can see it.
A psychic wind from the Astral Plane carried psionic energy to you. When you use your powers, faint motes of light sparkle around you.
You once suffered the dominating powers of an aboleth, leaving a psychic splinter in your mind.
You were implanted with a mind flayer tadpole, but the ceremorphosis never completed. And now its psionic power is yours. When you use it, your flesh shines with a strange mucus.
As a child, you had an imaginary friend that looked like a flumph or a strange platypus-like creature. One day, it gifted you with psionic powers, which have ended up being not so imaginary.
Your nightmares whisper the truth to you: your psionic powers are not your own. You draw them from your parasitic twin!

subclassFeature.name: Psionic Spells
entries: You learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown on the Psionic Spells table. Each of these spells counts as a sorcerer spell for you, but it doesn't count against the number of sorcerer spells you know.

Whenever you gain a sorcerer level, you can replace one spell you gained from this feature with another spell of the same level. The new spell must be a {@filter divination or an enchantment spell from the sorcerer, warlock, or wizard spell list|spells|class=sorcerer (Ishiir);warlock (Ishiir);wizard (Ishiir)|school=D;E|level=1;2;3;4;5|source=Ishiir}.

entries.caption: Psionic Spells
rows: {@spell Arms of Hadar|Ishiir}, {@spell Dissonant Whispers|Ishiir}, {@spell Mind Sliver|Ishiir}, {@spell Calm Emotions|Ishiir}, {@spell Detect Thoughts|Ishiir}

subclassFeature.name: Telepathic Speech
entries: You can form a telepathic connection between your mind and the mind of another. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, choose one creature you can see within 30 feet of you. You and the chosen creature can speak telepathically with each other while the two of you are within a number of miles of each other equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1 mile). To understand each other, you must both know at least one language.

The telepathic connection lasts for a number of minutes equal to your sorcerer level. It ends early if you are {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir} or die or if you use this ability to form a connection with a different creature.

subclassFeature.name: Psionic Sorcery
entries: When you cast any level 1+ spell from your Psionic Spells feature, you can cast it by expending a spell slot as normal or by spending a number of Sorcery Points equal to the spell's level. If you cast the spell using Sorcery Points, it requires no Verbal or Somatic components, and it requires no Material components unless they are consumed by the spell or have a cost specified in it.

subclassFeature.name: Psychic Defenses
entries: You gain {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to psychic damage, and you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} against being {@condition Charmed|Ishiir} or {@condition Frightened|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Revelation in Flesh
entries: You can unleash the aberrant truth hidden within yourself. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can spend 1 or more sorcery points to magically transform your body for 10 minutes. For each sorcery point you spend, you can gain one of the following benefits of your choice, the effects of which last until the transformation ends:

items: You can see any {@condition Invisible|Ishiir} creature within 60 feet of you, provided it isn't behind total cover. Your eyes also turn black or become writhing sensory tendrils.
You gain a {@variantrule Fly Speed|Ishiir} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir}, and you can hover. As you fly, your skin glistens with mucus or shines with an otherworldly light.

You gain a {@variantrule Swim Speed|Ishiir} equal to twice your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir}, and you can breathe underwater. Moreover, gills grow from your neck or fan out from behind your ears, your fingers become webbed, or you grow writhing cilia that extend through your clothing.

Your body, along with any equipment you are wearing or carrying, becomes slimy and pliable. You can move through any space as narrow as 1 inch without squeezing, and you can spend 5 feet of movement to escape from nonmagical restraints or being {@condition Grappled|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Warping Implosion
entries: You can unleash your aberrant power as a space-warping anomaly. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can teleport to an unoccupied space you can see within 120 feet of you. Immediately after you disappear, each creature within 30 feet of the space you left must make a Strength {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against your spell save DC. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 4d10} force damage and is pulled straight toward the space you left, ending in an unoccupied space as close to your former space as possible. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pulled.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, unless you spend 5 sorcery points to use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Clockwork Soul
entries: The cosmic force of order has suffused you with magic. That power arises from Mechanus or a realm like it-a plane of existence shaped entirely by clockwork efficiency. You, or someone from your lineage, might have become entangled in the machinations of the modrons, the orderly beings who inhabit Mechanus. Perhaps your ancestor even took part in the Great Modron March. Whatever its origin within you, the power of order can seem strange to others, but for you, it is part of a vast and glorious system.

subclassFeature.name: Clockwork Magic
entries: You learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown on the Clockwork Spells table. Each of these spells counts as a sorcerer spell for you, but it doesn't count against the number of sorcerer spells you know.

Whenever you gain a sorcerer level, you can replace one spell you gained from this feature with another spell of the same level. The new spell must be an {@filter abjuration or a transmutation spell from the sorcerer, warlock, or wizard spell list|spells|class=sorcerer (Ishiir);warlock (Ishiir);wizard (Ishiir)|school=A;T|level=1;2;3;4;5|source=Ishiir}.

entries.caption: Clockwork Spells
rows: {@spell Alarm|Ishiir}, {@spell Protection from Evil and Good|Ishiir}, {@spell Aid|Ishiir}, {@spell Lesser Restoration|Ishiir}

entries: In addition, consult the Manifestations of Order table and choose or randomly determine a way your connection to order manifests while you are casting any of your sorcerer spells.

entries.caption: Manifestations of Order
rows: The hands of a clock spin in your eyes.
Your skin glows with a brassy sheen.
Floating equations and geometric objects overlay your body.
Your spellcasting focus temporarily takes the form of a Tiny clockwork mechanism.
The ticking of gears or ringing of a clock can be heard by you and those affected by your magic.

subclassFeature.name: Restore Balance
entries: Your connection to the plane of absolute order allows you to equalize chaotic moments. When a creature you can see within 60 feet of yourself is about to roll a d20 with {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} or {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir}, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to prevent the roll from being affected by {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} and {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir}.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Bastion of Law
entries: You can tap into the grand equation of existence to imbue a creature with a shimmering shield of order. As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can expend 1 to 5 sorcery points to create a magical ward around yourself or another creature you can see within 30 feet of you. The ward lasts until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir} or until you use this feature again.

The ward is represented by a number of {@dice d8}s equal to the number of sorcery points spent to create it. When the warded creature takes damage, it can expend a number of those dice, roll them, and reduce the damage taken by the total rolled on those dice.

subclassFeature.name: Trance of Order
entries: You gain the ability to align your consciousness to the endless calculations of Mechanus. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can enter this state for 1 minute. For the duration, {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} against you can't benefit from {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir}, and whenever you make an {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}, an {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir}, or a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, you can treat a roll of 9 or lower on the {@dice d20} as a 10.
Once you use this {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, unless you spend 5 sorcery points to use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Clockwork Cavalcade
entries: You summon spirits of order to expunge disorder around you. As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you summon the spirits in a 30-foot cube originating from you. The spirits look like modrons or other constructs of your choice. The spirits are intangible and invulnerable, and they create the following effects within the cube before vanishing:

items: The spirits restore up to 100 hit points, divided as you choose among any number of creatures of your choice in the cube.
Any damaged objects entirely in the cube are repaired instantly.
Every spell of 6th level or lower ends on creatures and objects of your choice in the cube.

entries: Once you use this action, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, unless you spend 7 sorcery points to use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Divine Soul
entries: Sometimes the spark of magic that fuels a sorcerer comes from a divine source that glimmers within the soul. Having such a blessed soul is a sign that your innate magic might come from a distant but powerful familial connection to a divine being. Perhaps your ancestor was an angel, transformed into a mortal and sent to fight in a god's name.
Or your birth might align with an ancient prophecy, marking you as a servant of the gods or a chosen vessel of divine magic.

A Divine Soul, with a natural magnetism, is seen as a threat by some religious hierarchies. As an outsider who commands sacred power, a Divine Soul can undermine an existing order by claiming a direct tie to the divine.

In some cultures, only those who can claim the power of a Divine Soul may command religious power. In these lands, ecclesiastical positions are dominated by a few bloodlines and preserved over generations.

subclassFeature.name: Divine Magic
entries: Your link to the divine allows you to learn spells from the cleric class. When your Spellcasting feature lets you learn or replace a sorcerer cantrip or a sorcerer spell of 1st level or higher, you can choose the new spell from the cleric spell list or the sorcerer spell list. You must otherwise obey all the restrictions for selecting the spell, and it becomes a sorcerer spell for you.

In addition, you learn two additional 1st-level spells of your choice from the cleric spell list. These spells count as sorcerer spells for you, but they don't count against the number of sorcerer spells you know.
When you reach 3rd level, 5th, 7th, and 9th level in this class, you also learn two additional spells of 2nd, 3rd, 4th, and 5th level of your choice from the cleric spell, respectively.

subclassFeature.name: Favored by the Gods
entries: Divine power guards your destiny. If you fail a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or miss with an {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}, you can roll {@dice 2d4} and add it to the total, possibly changing the outcome. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, unless you use 2 sorcery points to use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Empowered Healing
entries: The divine energy coursing through you can empower healing spells. Whenever you or an ally within 5 feet of you rolls dice to determine the number of hit points a spell restores, you can spend 1 sorcery point to reroll any number of those dice once, provided you aren't {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir}. You can use this feature only once per turn.

subclassFeature.name: Otherworldly Wings
entries: You can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to manifest a pair of spectral wings from your back. While the wings are present, you have a {@variantrule Fly Speed|Ishiir} of 30 feet. The wings last until you're {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir}, you die, or you dismiss them as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}.
The affinity you chose for your Divine Magic feature determines the appearance of the spectral wings: eagle wings for good or law, bat wings for evil or chaos, and dragonfly wings for neutrality.

subclassFeature.name: Unearthly Recovery
entries: You gain the ability to overcome grievous injuries. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can regain a number of hit points equal to half your hit point maximum.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, unless you use 6 sorcery points to use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Bloodline
entries: Your innate magic comes from draconic magic that was mingled with your blood or that of your ancestors. Most often, sorcerers with this origin trace their descent back to a mighty sorcerer of ancient times who made a bargain with a dragon or who might even have claimed a dragon parent. Some of these bloodlines are well established in the world, but most are obscure. Any given sorcerer could be the first of a new bloodline, as a result of a pact or some other exceptional circumstance.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Magic
entries: You learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class. These spells depend on the damage type of your chosen ancestry, as shown in the tables below. The spells count as sorcerer spells for you, but they don't count against the number of sorcerer spells you know.

entries.caption: Draconic Acid Spells
rows: {@spell Create Or Destroy Water|Ishiir}, {@spell Tasha's Caustic Brew|Ishiir}, {@spell Darkvision|Ishiir}, {@spell Melf's Acid Arrow|Ishiir}
{@spell Hunger of Hadar|Ishiir}, {@spell Wall of Water|Ishiir}

entries.caption: Draconic Cold Spells
rows: {@spell Armor of Agathys|Ishiir}, {@spell Grease|Ishiir}, {@spell Rime's Binding Ice|Ishiir}, {@spell Snilloc's Snowball Swarm|Ishiir}

entries.caption: Draconic Fire Spells
rows: {@spell Burning Hands|Ishiir}, {@spell Hellish Rebuke|Ishiir}, {@spell Heat Metal|Ishiir}, {@spell Scorching Ray|Ishiir}

entries.caption: Draconic Lightning Spells
rows: {@spell Gift of Alacrity|Ishiir}, {@spell Witch Bolt|Ishiir}, {@spell Mirror Image|Ishiir}, {@spell Misty Step|Ishiir}

entries.caption: Draconic Poison Spells
rows: {@spell Command|Ishiir}, {@spell Ray of Sickness|Ishiir}, {@spell Protection from Poison|Ishiir}, {@spell Ray of Enfeeblement|Ishiir}

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Resilience
entries: As magic flows through your body, it causes physical traits of your dragon ancestors to emerge. Your hit point maximum increases by 3 and increases by 1 again whenever you gain a level in this class.
Additionally, parts of your skin are covered by a thin sheen of dragon-like scales. When you aren't wearing armor, your AC equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Charisma modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Dragon Ancestor
entries: You choose one type of dragon as your ancestor. The damage type associated with each dragon is used by features you gain later.

You can speak, read, and write {@language Draconic}. Additionally, whenever you make a Charisma check when interacting with dragons, your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus is doubled if it applies to the check.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Affinity
entries: You gain {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to the damage type associated with your draconic ancestry. Additionally, as an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can spend 2 sorcery points to give yourself {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir} to that damage type for 1 hour.

subclassFeature.name: Dragon Wings
entries: You gain the ability to sprout a pair of dragon wings from your back, gaining a {@variantrule Fly Speed|Ishiir} equal to your current {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir}. You can create these wings as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} on your turn. They last until you dismiss them as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} on your turn.
You can't manifest your wings while wearing armor unless the armor is made to accommodate them, and clothing not made to accommodate your wings might be destroyed when you manifest them.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Presence
entries: You can channel the dread presence of your dragon ancestor, causing those around you to become awestruck or frightened. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you draw on this power and exude an aura of awe or fear (your choice) to a distance of 60 feet. For 1 minute, each hostile creature that starts its turn in this aura or enters it for the first time on a turn must succeed on a Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or be {@condition Charmed|Ishiir} (if you chose awe) or {@condition Frightened|Ishiir} (if you chose fear) until the aura ends. A creature that succeeds on this {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} is {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to your aura for 24 hours.
Additionally, any spell that deals the damage type associated with your draconic ancestry is treated as 1 spell level higher for the purposes of its damage.
You cannot use this feature again until you have finished a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, unless you spend 5 sorcery points to use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Giant Soul
entries: The giants once dwelled in a fabled realm known as Ostoria, a paradise for their folk that reflected their mastery of the mortal realm. In time, Ostoria fell, and the giants were scattered and broken. During that mythic era, the giants granted a few chosen individuals among the small folk a shard of their great power. These favored people were caught in the same tragedy that sundered Ostoria. Since that time, they have spread across the many worlds of the multiverse. Now and again, one of their descendants manifests the gifts imparted by the giants, granting them sorcerous magic that allows them to command the elements and gain the might of a giant.

subclassFeature.name: Jotun Resilience
entries: The resilience of giants flows through your body. Your hit point maximum increases by 3, and it increases by 1 again whenever you gain a level in this class.
Additionally, when you aren't wearing armor, your AC equals 10 + your Strength modifier + your Charisma modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Mark of the Ordning
entries: You learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class. These spells depend on your chosen giant heritage, as shown in the tables below. The spells count as sorcerer spells for you, but they don't count against the number of sorcerer spells you know.

entries.caption: Cloud Giant Spells
rows: {@spell Fog Cloud|Ishiir}, {@spell Silent Image|Ishiir}, {@spell Invisibility|Ishiir}, {@spell Warding Wind|Ishiir}

entries.caption: Fire Giant Spells
rows: {@spell Burning Hands|Ishiir}, {@spell Catapult|Ishiir}, {@spell Enhance Ability|Ishiir}, {@spell Heat Metal|Ishiir}

entries.caption: Frost Giant Spells
rows: {@spell Armor of Agathys|Ishiir}, {@spell Frost Fingers|Ishiir}, {@spell Hold Person|Ishiir}, {@spell Snilloc's Snowball Swarm|Ishiir}

entries.caption: Hill Giant Spells
rows: {@spell Heroism|Ishiir}, {@spell Longstrider|Ishiir}, {@spell Earthbind|Ishiir}, {@spell Protection from Poison|Ishiir}
{@spell Create Food and Water|Ishiir}, {@spell Erupting Earth|Ishiir}

entries.caption: Stone Giant Spells
rows: {@spell Id Insinuation|Ishiir}, {@spell Sleep|Ishiir}, {@spell Calm Emotions|Ishiir}, {@spell Suggestion|Ishiir}

entries.caption: Storm Giant Spells
rows: {@spell Identify|Ishiir}, {@spell Witch Bolt|Ishiir}, {@spell Detect Thoughts|Ishiir}, {@spell Misty Step|Ishiir}

subclassFeature.name: Jotun Might
entries: You add your Charisma modifier to your strength {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks}.
Additionally, your melee weapon attacks deal an additional {@damage 1d10} damage of the weapon's type. This extra damage increases to {@damage 2d10} at 11th level and {@damage 3d10} at 17th level.

subclassFeature.name: Jotun Rage
entries: You gain the ability to channel the souls of your ancestors into your physical form. When you start casting a sorcerer spell on your turn and expend a spell slot, you can increase your size by one category—from Medium to Large, for example.
This increase lasts for 1 minute. It ends early if you die or are {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir}. Until it ends, you enjoy the following benefits:

items: Your current hit points and your hit point maximum both increase by 1 per sorcerer level.
Your reach increases by 5 feet.
Your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} increases by 5 feet.
You have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on strength {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks} and Strength {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws}.
If you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can shove or grapple that creature as part of the same attack.

entries: Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, unless you spend 4 sorcery points to use this feature again.

subclassFeature.name: Jotun Blessing
entries: Your Strength and Constitution scores increase by 2, up to a maximum of 22.

In addition, you can now use Jotun Rage twice between rests, but no more than once on a turn. If you use that feature while under its effects, its increases to your size, hit points, reach, and {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} are cumulative.

subclassFeature.name: Lunar Magic
entries: You, or someone from your lineage, has been exposed to the concentrated magic of the moon, imbuing you with lunar magic. Perhaps your ancestor was involved in a druidic ritual involving an eclipse, or maybe a mystical fragment of a moon crashed near you. However you came to have your magic, your connection to the moon is obvious when you cast sorcerer spells. Consult the Manifestations of Lunar Magic table, then choose or randomly determine how your connection to the moon manifests while you cast your sorcerer spells.

entries.caption: Manifestations of Lunar Magic
rows: You glow with faint light that matches the color of a moon from your world.
Your pupils shift in shape, matching the current phase of a moon from your world.
Spectral manifestations of the moon (or moons) of your world orbit you.
Your shadow is limned in faint light, as if it were a lunar body during a solar eclipse.

entries.name: Moon Fire
entries: You can call down the radiant light of the moon on command. You learn the {@spell Sacred Flame|Ishiir} spell, which doesn't count against the number of sorcerer cantrips you know. When you cast the spell, you can target one creature as normal or target two creatures within range that are within 5 feet of each other.

entries.name: Lunar Embodiment
entries: You learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown on the Lunar Spells table. Each of these spells counts as a sorcerer spell for you, but it doesn't count against the number of sorcerer spells you know.

Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, you can choose what lunar phase manifests its power through your magic: Full Moon, New Moon, or Crescent Moon. While in the chosen phase, spells of the associated phase in the Lunar Spells table can be cast once without expending a spell slot. Once you {@action Magic|Ishiir|cast a spell} in this way, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Lunar Phenomenon
entries: Your lunar phase magic bursts. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can tap into a special power of the lunar phase you are currently in. Alternatively, as part of the {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} you take to change your lunar phase using your Waxing and Waning feature, you can immediately use the power of the lunar phase you are entering:

items.name: Full Moon:
entries: You radiate intense moonlight for a moment. Each creature of your choice within 30 feet of you must succeed on a Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against your spell save DC or be {@condition Blinded|Ishiir} until the end of its next turn. In addition, one creature of your choice in that area regains {@dice 3d8} hit points.

items.name: New Moon:
entries: You momentarily emanate an oppressive gloom. Each creature of your choice within 30 feet of you must succeed on a Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against your spell save DC or take {@damage 3d10} psychic damage and have its {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} reduced to 0 until the end of its next turn. In addition, you become {@condition Invisible|Ishiir} until the end of your next turn, or until you make an attack or {@action Magic|Ishiir|cast a spell}.

items.name: Crescent Moon:
entries: You slip through light and darkness. You can magically teleport to an unoccupied space you can see within 60 feet of yourself. In addition, you also gain {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to all damage until the start of your next turn.
Once you use a phase's {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, unless you spend 5 sorcery points to use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Lunar Boons
entries: Lunar phases influence your metamagic. Each lunar phase is associated with spells of the following schools of magic:

items.name: Full Moon
entries: Abjuration and conjuration spells

items.name: New Moon
entries: Evocation and necromancy spells

items.name: Crescent Moon
entries: Divination and transmutation spells

Whenever you use Metamagic on a spell from the Lunar Spells table or a spell of a school of magic associated with the lunar phase you are in, you can reduce the sorcery points spent by 1 (minimum 0). You can reduce the sorcery points spent for your Metamagic a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}

subclassFeature.name: Waxing and Waning
entries: You gain greater control over the phases of your lunar magic. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can spend 1 sorcery point to change your lunar phase for a different one.

subclassFeature.name: Lunar Empowerment
entries: The power of a lunar phase saturates your being. Whenever you choose a lunar phase to affect your magic, you also gain the following benefit associated with that phase:

items.name: Full Moon:
items.entry: You shed bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. In addition, you and creatures of your choice have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} while within the bright light you shed.

items.name: New Moon:
items.entry: You have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks}. In addition, while you are in dim light or darkness, {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} have {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} against you.

items.name: Crescent Moon:
items.entry: You have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to necrotic and radiant damage

subclassFeature.name: Phoenix Sorcery
entries: Your power draws from the immortal flame that fuels the legendary phoenix. You or your ancestors perhaps rendered a phoenix a great service, or you were born in its presence. Whatever the cause, a shard of the phoenix's power dwells within you.

That power is a mixed blessing. Like the mythical creature, you can invoke fiery energy and gain the ability to cheat death itself. This power comes at a cost. The fire within you seethes, demanding to be unleashed. You sometimes find yourself absentmindedly feeding fires. You can't bear to allow a fire to sputter out. You feel most comfortable while holding a lit torch or sitting in front of a campfire.

More importantly, this gift comes with no special protection from fire. You are as vulnerable as any other creature to fiery magic, including your own. Phoenix sorcerers can use their powers to pull themselves back from the brink of death, and all too often their own, rash nature or reliance on destructive magic is what puts them there in the first place.

Such sorcerers are wanderers by necessity. The volatile nature of their magic makes other folk nervous. If a fire breaks out in town, a phoenix sorcerer had best flee, whether guilty or not. Fire is a dangerous force, and phoenix sorcerers have a reputation (deserved or not) for reckless behavior, confident that the essence of the phoenix can save them.

entries.caption: Phoenix Soul Quirks
rows: You absentmindedly ignite small fires that quickly sputter out.
You cackle like a fiend when you unleash your fire spells.
You admire fire, even if it burns your friends.
You are covered in burns that mark the first time your power manifested.
You are brave to the point of recklessness.

subclassFeature.name: Mantle of Flame
entries: You can unleash the phoenix fire that blazes within you.
As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you magically wreathe yourself in swirling fire, as your eyes glow like hot coals. For 1 minute, you gain the following benefits:

items: You shed bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet.
Any creature takes fire damage equal to your Charisma modifier if it hits you with a melee attack from within 10 feet of you or if it touches you.
Whenever you roll fire damage on your turn, the roll gains a bonus to equal to your Charisma modifier.

entries: Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, unless you spend 2 sorcery points to use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Phoenix Magic
entries: You learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown on the table below. Each of these spells counts as a sorcerer spell for you, but it doesn't count against the number of sorcerer spells you know.

entries.caption: Phoenix Spells
rows: {@spell Burning Hands|Ishiir}, {@spell Cure Wounds|Ishiir}, {@spell Lesser Restoration|Ishiir}, {@spell Aganazzar's Scorcher|Ishiir}

subclassFeature.name: Phoenix Spark
entries: The fiery energy within you grows restless and vengeful. In the face of defeat, it surges outward to preserve you in a fiery roar.
If you are reduced to 0 hit points, you can instead be reduced to 1 hit point, and each creature within 10 feet of you takes fire damage equal to half your sorcerer level + your Charisma modifier.

If you use this feature while under the effects of your Mantle of Flame, this feature instead deals fire damage equal to your sorcerer level + double your Charisma modifier, and your Mantle of Flame immediately ends.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Form of the Phoenix
entries: You finally master the spark of fire that dances within you. When you activate your Mantle of Flame feature, you can choose to empower its effects:

items: You have a {@variantrule Fly Speed|Ishiir} of 40 feet and can hover.
You have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to all damage.
If you use your Phoenix Spark, that feature deals an extra 20 fire damage to each creature.

entries: Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, unless you spend 7 sorcery points to use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Ignite
entries: You gain the ability to start fires with a touch. As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can magically ignite a flammable object you touch with your hand—an object such as a torch, a piece of tinder, or the hem of drapes.

subclassFeature.name: Nourishing Fire
entries: Your fire spells soothe and restore you. When you expend a spell slot to {@action Magic|Ishiir|cast a spell} that includes a fire damage roll, you regain hit points equal to the slot's level + your Charisma modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Pyromancer
entries: Your innate magic manifests in fire. You are your fire, and your fire is you.

subclassFeature.name: Pyromancy
entries: You learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown on the table below. Each of these spells counts as a sorcerer spell for you, but it doesn't count against the number of sorcerer spells you know.

entries.caption: Pyromancy Spells
rows: {@spell Burning Hands|Ishiir}, {@spell Faerie Fire|Ishiir}, {@spell Flaming Sphere|Ishiir}, {@spell Scorching Ray|Ishiir}

subclassFeature.name: Wildfire
entries: You gain {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to fire damage and when you {@action Magic|Ishiir|cast a spell} that deals fire damage, you can choose any creature you can see within 120 ft of you that is currently affected by your Heart of Fire feature as the point of origin. If you do so, the effect of Heart of Fire ends on it.

subclassFeature.name: Heart of Fire
entries: Whenever you hit a creature with a spell of 1st level or higher that deals fire damage or it fails a save against such a spell, you also set it aflame.

A creature that is aflame takes fire damage equal to twice your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} at the start of each of its turns and sheds bright light in a radius of 10 feet and dim light light in a radius of 10 feet beyond that for 1 minute.

At the end of each of its turns, an affected creature can make a DEX {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against your spell save DC to end the effect on itself. Alternatively, it or another creature can spend an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to put out the flames.

subclassFeature.name: Living Bomb
entries: The damage dealt by your Heart of Fire feature increases to three times your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir}.

When a creature affected by your Heart of Fire feature that you can see is reduced to 0 hit points by fire damage, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to make it explode violently. Any creature in a 20 feet radius around the target has to make a DEX {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against your spell save DC. On a failure, a creature takes fire damage equal to a number of d6 x your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} and is then set aflame as per your Heart of Fire feature. On a success, it takes half as much damage and isn't set aflame.

subclassFeature.name: Blazing Soul
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can magically transform into a creature of living flame. In this form, you have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to piercing, bludgeoning, and slashing damage as well as {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir} to fire damage and poison.

Additionally, if a creature hits you with a melee attack from within 10 ft or touches you, it takes fire damage equal to half your sorcerer level. Additionally, you add your Charisma modifier to the damage of all the other features gained from this subclass that deal fire damage.
You remain in this form for 1 minute. It ends early if you are {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir}, if you die, or if you dismiss it as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}.
Once you have used this feature, you cannot use it again until you have finished a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, unless you spend 6 sorcery points to use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Sea Sorcery
entries: The power of water is the strength of flexibility, resilience, and a relentless nature. Water parts to allow a ship to sail over it or a diver to plunge into it, but their passing leaves no mark. Water flowing down a mountain reaches the sea. It might bend and turn across valleys and down hillsides, but it slowly and steadily returns to the waves. Those whose souls are touched by the power of elemental water command a similar power.

Your heritage ties to powerful creatures of the sea, such as nereids, the lords of the merfolk, and elemental powers. Like a river, you feel the call of the ocean. The call is ever present in your heart, and you are never completely at peace until you are near the sea.

subclassFeature.name: Sea Magic
entries: You learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown on the table below. Each of these spells counts as a sorcerer spell for you, but it doesn't count against the number of sorcerer spells you know.

entries.caption: Sea Spells
rows: {@spell Create Or Destroy Water|Ishiir}, {@spell Witch Bolt|Ishiir}, {@spell Mirror Image|Ishiir}, {@spell Misty Step|Ishiir}

subclassFeature.name: Curse of the Sea
entries: You learn the secret of infusing your spells with a watery curse.

When you hit a creature with a cantrip's attack or when a creature fails a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against your cantrip, you can curse the target until the end of your next turn or until you curse a different creature with this feature.

Once per turn when you {@action Magic|Ishiir|cast a spell}, you can trigger the curse if that spell deals cold or lightning damage to the cursed target or forces it to move. Doing so subjects the target to the appropriate additional effect below, and then the curse ends if the spell isn't a cantrip (you choose the effect to use if more than one effect applies):

entries.name: Cold damage
entries: If the affected target takes cold damage from your spell, the target's {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} is also reduced by 15 feet until the end of your next turn. If the spell already reduces the target's {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir}, use whichever reduction is greater.

entries.name: Lightning Damage
entries: If the affected target takes lightning damage from your spell, the target takes additional lightning damage equal to your Charisma modifier.

entries.name: Forced Movement
entries: If the target is moved by your spell, increase the distance it is moved by 15 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Soul of the Sea
entries: Your tie to the sea grants you the ability to breathe underwater, and you have a {@variantrule Swim Speed|Ishiir} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir}. If you already have a {@variantrule Swim Speed|Ishiir}, that {@variantrule Swim Speed|Ishiir} instead increases by 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Watery Defense
entries: You gain {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to fire damage.

You also gain the ability to defend yourself by momentarily assuming a watery form. As a {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} when you are hit by an attack and take bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage from it, you can reduce that damage by an amount equal to your sorcerer level plus your Charisma score, and then you can move up to 30 feet without provoking {@action Opportunity Attack|Ishiir|Opportunity Attacks}. Once you use this special {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir}, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, or you use 3 sorcery points to use this feature again.

subclassFeature.name: Shifting Form
entries: You gain the ability to enter a liquid state while moving.
When you move on your turn, you take only half damage from {@action Opportunity Attack|Ishiir|Opportunity Attacks}, and you can move through any enemy's space but can't willingly end your move there.

On your turn, you can move through any space that is at least 3 inches in diameter and do so without squeezing. When you stop moving, the regular squeezing rules apply if you're in a space one size smaller than you. You can't willingly stop in a space smaller than that, and if you're forced to do so, you immediately flow to the nearest space that can fit you, back along the path of your movement.

If you start your turn with the {@condition Grappled|Ishiir} and/or {@condition Restrained|Ishiir} condition, you can spend half your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} to immediately end those effects on you.

subclassFeature.name: Water Soul
entries: Your being is altered by the power of the sea. You gain the following benefits:

items: You no longer need to eat, drink, or sleep.
A critical hit against you becomes a normal hit.
You have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

subclassFeature.name: Shadow Magic
entries: You are a creature of shadow, for your innate magic comes from the Shadowfell itself. You might trace your lineage to an entity from that place, or perhaps you were exposed to its fell energy and transformed by it.

The power of shadow magic casts a strange pall over your physical presence. The spark of life that sustains you is muffled, as if it struggles to remain viable against the dark energy that imbues your soul. At your option, you can pick from or roll on the Shadow Sorcerer Quirks table to create a quirk for your character.

entries.caption: Shadow Sorcerer Quirks
rows: You are always icy cold to the touch.
When you are asleep, you don't appear to breathe (though you must still breathe to survive).
You barely bleed, even when badly injured.
Your heart beats once per minute. This event sometimes surprises you.
You have trouble remembering that living creatures and corpses should be treated differently.

subclassFeature.name: Strength of the Grave
entries: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. This feature does not work if the triggering damage was radiant or a critical hit. You can't use this feature again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

Additionally, you learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown on the table below. Each of these spells counts as a sorcerer spell for you, but it doesn't count against the number of sorcerer spells you know.

entries.caption: Shadow Spells
rows: {@spell Arms of Hadar|Ishiir}, {@spell Hex|Ishiir}, {@spell Blindness/Deafness|Ishiir}, {@spell Ray of Enfeeblement|Ishiir}

subclassFeature.name: Eyes of the Dark
entries: You have {@sense darkvision} with a range of 120 feet.

When you reach 3rd level in this class, you learn the {@spell Darkness|Ishiir} spell, which doesn't count against your number of sorcerer spells known. In addition, you can cast it by spending 2 sorcery points or by expending a spell slot. If you cast it with sorcery points, you can see through the {@spell Darkness|Ishiir} created by the spell.

subclassFeature.name: Hound of Ill Omen
entries: You gain the ability to call forth a howling creature of darkness to harass your foes. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can spend 3 sorcery points to magically summon a hound of ill omen to target one creature you can see within 120 feet of you. The hound uses the {@creature dire wolf}'s statistics (see the Monster Manual or appendix C in the Player's Handbook), with the following changes:

items: The hound is size Medium, not Large, and it counts as a monstrosity, not a beast.
It appears with a number of temporary hit points equal to half your sorcerer level.
It can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@quickref difficult terrain||3}. The hound takes 5 force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.
At the start of its turn, the hound automatically knows its target's location. If the target was hidden, it is no longer hidden from the hound.

entries: The hound appears in an unoccupied space of your choice within 30 feet of the target. Roll initiative for the hound. On its turn, it can move only toward its target by the most direct route, and it can use its action only to attack its target. The hound can make {@action Opportunity Attack|Ishiir|Opportunity Attacks}, but only against its target. Additionally, while the hound is within 5 feet of the target, the target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} against any spell you cast. The hound disappears if it is reduced to 0 hit points, if its target is reduced to 0 hit points, or after 5 minutes.

subclassFeature.name: Shadow Walk
entries: You gain the ability to step from one shadow into another. When you are in dim light or darkness, as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can magically teleport up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space you can see that is also in dim light or darkness.

subclassFeature.name: Umbral Form
entries: You can magically transform yourself into a shadowy form as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}. In this form, you have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to all damage except force and radiant damage, and you can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@quickref difficult terrain||3}. You take 5 force damage if you end your turn inside an object.
You remain in this form for 1 minute. It ends early if you are {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir}, if you die, or if you dismiss it as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}.
Once you have used this feature, you cannot use it again until you have finished a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, unless you spend 6 sorcery points to use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Sword Mage
entries: Your link to sword magic grants you extraordinary resilience, and sword mages have a natural affinity for combat. A steel blade feels like a natural extension of your body, and sorcerers with this origin have a knack for wielding both shields and weapons. In combat your place is amid the fray. You rely on your magic and metal weapons to shield you from harm and overwhelm your foes.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} with shields, simple weapons, and martial weapons.

subclassFeature.name: Tempered Blade
entries: Your connection to sword magic gives you extra fortitude. Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 again whenever you gain a level in this class.

As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can gain a base AC of 10 + your Constitution modifier + your Charisma modifier if you aren't wearing armor. This effect lasts until you end it as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} or you don armor other than a shield.

subclassFeature.name: Sword and Sorcery
entries: You learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown on the table below. Each of these spells counts as a sorcerer spell for you, but it doesn't count against the number of sorcerer spells you know.

entries.caption: Sword Mage Spells
rows: {@spell Compelled Duel|Ishiir}, {@spell Wrathful Smite|Ishiir}, {@spell Branding Smite|Ishiir}, {@spell Magic Weapon|Ishiir}

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Aegis
entries: Your command of sword magic grows stronger, allowing you to harness it for protection.

As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can grant an aegis to yourself or one allied creature you can see within 60 feet of you. The aegis is a dim, gray aura of earth magic that protects the target. Any bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage the target takes is reduced by half your sorcerer level (rounded down). This effect lasts for 1 minute or until you use it again.

In addition, when a creature you can see within 60 feet of you hits the protected target with a melee attack, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to teleport to an unoccupied space you can see within 5 feet of the attacker. You can teleport only if you and the attacker are on the same surface. You can then make one melee weapon attack against the attacker. If that attack hits, it deals an extra {@damage 1d10} force damage. This extra damage increases to {@dice 2d10} at 11th level and {@dice 3d10} at 17th level.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Edge
entries: Your mastery of sword magic allows you to enhance your melee attacks. When you make a melee attack, the target takes extra force damage equal to half your sorcerer level.

subclassFeature.name: Sword Sage's Aegis
entries: When you use your Arcane Aegis to protect an ally, you can choose up to three creatures to gain its benefits.

Additionally, when you have no {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} remaining and a creature triggers the {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} attack from your Arcane Aegis feature, you can spend 2 sorcery points to use the attack without a {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir}. You can do so only once per turn.

subclassFeature.name: Storm Sorcery
entries: Your innate magic comes from the power of elemental air. Many with this power can trace their magic back to a near-death experience caused by the Great Rain, but perhaps you were born during a howling gale so powerful that folk still tell stories of it, or your lineage might include the influence of potent air creatures such as djinn. Whatever the case, the magic of the storm permeates your being.

Storm sorcerers are invaluable members of a ship's crew. Their magic allows them to exert control over wind and weather in their immediate area. Their abilities also prove useful in repelling attacks by sahuagin, pirates, and other waterborne threats.

subclassFeature.name: Tempestuous Magic
entries: You can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} on your turn to cause whirling gusts of elemental air to briefly surround you, immediately before or after you {@action Magic|Ishiir|cast a spell} of 1st level or higher. Doing so allows you to fly up to 30 feet without provoking {@action Opportunity Attack|Ishiir|Opportunity Attacks}.

Additionally, you learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown on the table below. Each of these spells counts as a sorcerer spell for you, but it doesn't count against the number of sorcerer spells you know.

entries.caption: Storm Spells
rows: {@spell Thunderwave|Ishiir}, {@spell Witch Bolt|Ishiir}, {@spell Shatter|Ishiir}, {@spell Warding Wind|Ishiir}

subclassFeature.name: Wind Speaker
entries: The arcane magic you command is infused with elemental air. You can speak, read, and write {@language Primordial}. Knowing this language allows you to understand and be understood by those who speak its dialects: {@language Primordial||Aquan}, {@language Primordial||Auran}, {@language Primordial||Ignan}, and {@language Primordial||Terran}.

subclassFeature.name: Heart of the Storm
entries: You gain {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to lightning and thunder damage. In addition, whenever you start casting a spell of 1st level or higher that deals lightning or thunder damage, stormy magic erupts from you. This eruption causes creatures of your choice that you can see within 10 feet of you to take lightning or thunder damage (choose each time this ability activates) equal to half your sorcerer level.

subclassFeature.name: Storm Guide
entries: You gain the ability to subtly control the weather around you.

If it is raining, you can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to cause the rain to stop falling in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on you. You can end this effect as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}.

If it is windy, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} each round to choose the direction that the wind blows in a 100-foot-radius sphere centered on you. The wind blows in that direction until the end of your next turn. This feature doesn't alter the speed of the wind.

subclassFeature.name: Storm's Fury
entries: When you are hit by a melee attack, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to deal lightning or thunder (your choice) damage to the attacker. The damage equals your sorcerer level. The attacker must also make a Strength {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against your sorcerer spell save DC. On a failed save, the attacker is pushed in a straight line up to 20 feet away from you.

subclassFeature.name: Wind Soul
entries: You gain {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir} to lightning and thunder damage.

You also gain a magical {@variantrule Fly Speed|Ishiir} of 60 feet. As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can reduce your {@variantrule Fly Speed|Ishiir} to 30 feet for 1 hour and choose a number of creatures within 30 feet of you equal to 3 + your Charisma modifier. The chosen creatures gain a magical {@variantrule Fly Speed|Ishiir} of 30 feet for 1 hour. Once you reduce your {@variantrule Fly Speed|Ishiir} in this way, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Wild Magic
entries: Your innate magic comes from the wild forces of chaos that underlie the order of creation. You might have endured exposure to some form of raw magic, perhaps through a planar portal leading to Limbo, the Elemental Planes, or the mysterious Far Realm. Perhaps you were blessed by a powerful fey creature or marked by a demon. Or your magic could be a fluke of your birth, with no apparent cause or reason. However it came to be, this chaotic magic churns within you, waiting for any outlet.

subclassFeature.name: Tides of Chaos
entries: You can manipulate the forces of chance and chaos to gain {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on one {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}, {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir}, or {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. Once you do so, you must finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir} or roll on the Wild Surge table before you can use this feature again.

Any time before you regain the use of this feature, you roll on the {@table Wild Magic Surge|PHB} table immediately after you cast a sorcerer spell of 1st level or higher. You then regain the use of this feature.

subclassFeature.name: Wild Magic Surge
entries: Your spellcasting can unleash surges of untamed magic. Immediately after you cast a sorcerer spell of 1st level or higher, the DM can have you roll a {@dice d20}. If you roll a 1, roll on the Wild Magic Surge table to create a random magical effect. A Wild Magic Surge can happen once per turn.

If a Wild Magic effect is a spell, it's too wild to be affected by Metamagic. If it normally requires {@condition Concentration|Ishiir}, it doesn't require {@condition Concentration|Ishiir} in this case; the spell lasts for its full duration.

entries.name: The Bigger, Badder Wild Magic Surge Table
entries.caption: The Bigger, Badder Wild Magic Surge Table
rows: Roll on this table at the start of each of your turns for the next minute. If you roll a 1 on your d100 again, reroll the d100 until you get a different result.
Roll a {@dice d100}. Your weight changes by a number of lbs equal to the roll. If the roll is odd, you grow lighter. If the roll is even, you grow heavier. Your physical appearance doesn't change.
You gain {@sense truesight} with a range of 30 feet.

You exude a terrible odor within a radius of 15 feet for {@dice 1d4} days. Any creature that starts its turn in that radius or enters it for the first time on a turn has to make a Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, on a failure it has to spend its action retching and hacking.
An elemental chosen and controlled by the DM appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you, then disappears 1 minute later.
You cast {@spell Daylight|Ishiir} on yourself. For the duration, the area of the spell travels with you.
You cast {@spell Fireball|Ishiir} at the highest spell level available to you (min. 3rd level), centered on yourself.
Your body becomes ooze-like for {@dice 1d4} hours. You gain the amorphous monster trait, allowing you to move through spaces as narrow as 1 inch without squeezing.

Roll a {@dice d10}. Your height changes by a number of inches equal to the roll. If the roll is odd, you shrink. If the roll is even, you grow. If you are male, half the result of the d10 is also added to or subtracted from your genital size as inches, using the same rules.
For the next {@dice 1d10} days, you can cast {@spell Speak with Dead|Ishiir} at will without somatic or material components.
You cast {@spell Confusion|Ishiir} at the highest spell level available to you (min. 4th level), centered on yourself.
You regain your lowest-level used spell slot.
For the next minute, you regain an amount of hitpoints equal to your sorcery point maximum at the beginning of each of your turns.
Your biological gender is reversed. A {@spell Remove Curse|Ishiir} spell can end this effect.

You grow a long beard made of feathers that remains until you sneeze. When you speak more than one word at a time or {@action Magic|Ishiir|cast a spell} with a verbal component, roll a {@dice d6}. On a 1, you sneeze and immediately roll again on this table. If you were casting a spell at the time, the casting fails, but you do not expend the spell slot.
You have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} against spells and other magical effects for 1 minute.
You cast {@spell Grease|Ishiir} centered on yourself.
For the next minute, the first metamagic you use on a turn does not cost sorcery points.

Creatures have {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} against the next spell you cast in the next minute that involves a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}.
You cast {@spell Insect Plague|Ishiir} at the highest available spell level to you (min. 5th level), centered on yourself.

An eye appears on your forehead for the next minute. During that time, you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks} that rely on sight. Additionally, when a creature you can see within 60 feet of you makes an {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir}, {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}, or {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to cause that roll to have either {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} or {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir}.
You cast {@spell Otto's Irresistible Dance|Ishiir} on yourself.
For the next minute, all your spells with a casting time of 1 action have a casting time of 1 {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}.
You and every creature within 60 feet of you have to make a CHA {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or suffer the effects of the {@spell Slow|Ishiir} spell.
You teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see.

You and one creature of your choice that you can see within 60 feet of you are magically compelled into a dance-off. Both you and your target have to make a Charisma (Performance) check. A creature that is {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to the {@condition Charmed|Ishiir} condition can ignore this effect, but automatically loses the contest if it chooses not to dance and its opponent does. The winner of the contest gains a bardic inspiration (d12) as per the class feature. The loser has {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on the next {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}, {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir}, or {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} they make before the end of your next turn.
You cast {@spell Faerie Fire|Ishiir}, centered on yourself.
Maximize the damage of the next damaging spell you cast within the next minute.
For {@dice 1d4} days, your hands trail faint rainbows when you move them.

Roll a {@dice d10}. Your age changes by a number of years equal to the roll. If the roll is odd, you get younger (minimum 1 year old). If the roll is even, you get older. If you are made younger, you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws}, but {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} and vice versa if you are made older instead. A {@spell Remove Curse|Ishiir} spell can end this effect.
You conjure a kitchen utensil or piece of cutlery such as a spoon or rolling pin in a space you can see within 5 ft of you and cast {@spell Animate Objects|Ishiir} on it.
A beast chosen and controlled by the DM appears in unoccupied spaces within 60 feet of you. It is hostile to every creature other than you and vanishes after 1 minute.
You cast {@spell Evard's Black Tentacles|Ishiir}, centered on yourself.
Roll a number of {@dice d10} equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir}. You regain hitpoints equal to the total.
For the next {@dice 1d10} days, you are under the effects of the {@spell Speak with Animals|Ishiir} and {@spell Speak with Plants|Ishiir} spells.
For the next minute, you can exchange places with a creature of your choice you can see within 20 feet as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} on each of your turns.
For every time you cast a cantrip within the next minute, you find a gold coin behind one of your ears.
You cast {@spell Levitate|Ishiir} on yourself. You are treated as a willing creature for the purpose of this spell. At the start of each of your turns, you float 20 feet higher into the air.
You cast {@spell Spider Climb|Ishiir} on yourself, but the duration is 24 hours.

A djinn chosen and controlled by the DM appears within 5 feet of you. Roll a {@dice d20}. On a roll of 1-10, the djinn is hostile to you. On a roll of 11-20, the djinn grants you a limited wish. You can request the effect of one spell that is 6th level or lower and has a casting time of 1 action. The spell can be from any class's spell list. If the djinn is hostile, it vanishes after 1 minute, otherwise it disappears after granting your wish or after 1 hour, whichever is earlier.

The first time you kill a creature with damage from a spell within the next minute, it explodes into fireworks and confetti, raining down {dice 1d4} sylvan candy and {@dice 5d100} gold pieces in a radius of 10 feet. For each size category above medium, increase the amount by {@dice 1d4} sylvan candy and {@dice 5d100} gold pieces.
You can't speak for the next minute. Whenever you try, you instead belch so loudly it can be heard within 300 feet and pink bubbles float out of your mouth.

You become semi-incorporeal for the next {@dice 1d4} hours. You can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. You take 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if you end your turn inside an object. Additionally, you are {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to the {@condition Grappled|Ishiir} and {@condition Restrained|Ishiir} conditions for the duration.

A spectral shield hovers near you for the next minute, granting you a +5 bonus to AC and {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir} to {@spell Magic Missile|Ishiir}. This effect does not stack with the {@spell Shield|Ishiir} spell.
You grow additional physical features belonging to an animal of the DM's choice (such as ears, horns, or a tail). A {@spell Remove Curse|Ishiir} spell can end this effect.
You are {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to being intoxicated by alcohol for the next {@dice 5d6} days.
You cast {@spell Thunder Step|Ishiir} at the highest spell level available to you (min. 3rd level).

Your hair falls out but grows back with a different color within 24 hours. After another 24 hours, it falls out again and the process repeats, each time with another color. A {@spell Remove Curse|Ishiir} spell can end this effect.

A fey chosen and controlled by the DM appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you, then disappears 1 minute later. At the start of each of its turns, you roll a {@dice d6}. On a 1 to 3, the creature is hostile to you and your companions this turn. On a 4 to 6, it is friendly to you.
For the next minute, any flammable object you touch that isn't being worn or carried by another creature bursts into flame.
The first time within the next minute you {@action Magic|Ishiir|cast a spell} of 1st level or higher, you lose a number of hit dice equal to the spell's level.
You regain your highest-level expended spell slot.
You and all creatures within 60 feet of you have to make a Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or become drunk for {@dice 1d4} hours.
For the next minute, you must shout when you speak.
A halo of glowing letters appears around your head. For the next hour, you automatically know when someone is lying.
You cast {@spell Fog Cloud|Ishiir} at the highest spell level available to you (min. 1st level), centered on yourself.
Your tongue turns a silvery color. For the next 24 hours, you speak and understand all languages.
Roll a number of {@dice d10} equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir}. Up to three creatures you choose within 30 feet of you take lightning damage equal to the total.

Your eyes glow with scintillating colors for 24 hours and are clearly visible up to 300 feet away. You can see normally in darkness and dim light, both magical and nonmagical, to a distance of 120 feet. If you have darkvision, the range of this effect increases by 60 feet.

You are {@condition Frightened|Ishiir} by the nearest creature you can see until the end of your next turn. While {@condition Frightened|Ishiir} in this manner, your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} is doubled and you have to immediately spend all your movement to move away from the creature in a straight line until you are at least 60 feet away from it or no longer have line of sight of it.

A celestial chosen and controlled by the DM appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you, then disappears 1 minute later. It seeks out the creature it can see that is closest to its own alignment and protects it for the duration. If multiple creatures are equally close to its alignment, it chooses the one closest to it.
Each creature within 30 feet of you becomes {@condition Invisible|Ishiir} for the next minute. The invisibility ends on a creature when it attacks or casts a spell.
You cast {@spell Blindness/Deafness|Ishiir} on yourself, choosing the blind option.
You gain {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to all damage for the next minute.
You and every creature within 60 feet of you gains the effect of the {@spell Haste|Ishiir} spell.
A random creature within 60 feet of you becomes drunk for {@dice 1d4} hours.
Your size decreases by one size category for the next minute.

For the next 24 hours, you replace every adjective and adverb with a form of “nice” when you speak. Every time you fail to do so, you take psychic damage equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir}. If the time passes and you have not failed to do so (though must have done so successfully at least 7 times), you gain an inspiration.
You flare in an intense bright light in a 300-foot radius for a brief moment. Any creature in that radius is {@condition Blinded|Ishiir} until the end of your next turn.
You cast {@spell Polymorph|Ishiir} on yourself. If you fail the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, you turn into a sheep for the spell's duration.
You speak with a lisp for the next 24 hours.
You cast the {@spell Mislead|Ishiir} spell on yourself.
A loud voice narrates your actions and thoughts for the next 24 hours. It can be heard up to 100 feet away.
You can take one additional action immediately.
You cast {@spell Stoneskin|Ishiir} on yourself at the highest spell level available to you (min. 4th level). For the duration, your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} becomes 10 ft.

Roll a number of {dice d10} equal to half your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} (rounded down). Each creature within 30 feet of you takes necrotic damage equal to the total. You regain hit points equal to the sum of the necrotic damage dealt.
You are {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to all conditions for the next minute.
You cast {@spell Mirror Image|Ishiir} on yourself.

For the next minute, your hands become incredibly slippery. You cannot hold objects. If you attempt to, they slip out of your hands and drop within 5 ft of you. If you attempt to grapple a creature, you automatically fail.
You cast {@spell Fly|Ishiir} on a random creature within 60 feet of you.
Until the start of your next turn, every creature within 30 feet of you also has to roll on this table when they {@action Magic|Ishiir|cast a spell} of 1st level or higher.
You become {@condition Invisible|Ishiir} for the next minute. During that time, other creatures can't hear you. The invisibility ends if you attack or {@action Magic|Ishiir|cast a spell}.

For the next {@dice 1d4} days, you can change the color of any open fire within 10 feet of you to one of your choosing. The chosen color remains until the fire is extinguished, you choose a different color, or this effect on you ends.
If you die within the next minute, you immediately come back to life as if by the {@spell Reincarnate|Ishiir} spell.
You break your attunement with {@dice 1d3} of the magic items to which you are attuned.
Your size increases by one size category for the next minute.
You cast {@spell Improved Haste|Ishiir} on a random creature within 60 feet of you.
You and all creatures within 30 feet of you gain vulnerability to all damage for the next minute.
You cast {@spell Freedom of Movement|Ishiir} on yourself.

Your skin turns a vibrant shade of blue and you become extremely attractive to fey creatures, who will start seeking you out from miles around. A {@spell Remove Curse|Ishiir} spell can end this effect.

You turn into a potted plant until the start of your next turn. While a plant, you are {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir} and have vulnerability to all damage. If you drop to 0 hit points, you die and your form reverts.

Your spellcasting focus turns into a banana for 1 hour. It retains all its previous properties. As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can throw it at a creature you can see within 60 feet of you. The attack automatically hits and deals force damage equal to your sorcerer level + your Charisma modifier. It then immediately returns to your hands. No one expects the banana.

You become covered in thick coat of long fur that falls even over your eyes and regrows instantly when it is cut or otherwise damaged. You gain {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to cold damage and have {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on Wisdom (Perception) {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks}. A {@spell Remove Curse|Ishiir} spell can end this effect.
{@dice 1d4} random pastries from within a 1 mile radius are teleported into your hands. If your hands are occupied, they are dumped on your head instead.

For the next 24 hours, you must rhyme when you speak. Every time you fail to do so, you take psychic damage equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir}. If the time passes and you have not failed to rhyme (though must have done so successfully at least 7 times), you gain an inspiration.
You cast {@spell Flesh  to Stone|Ishiir} on yourself. If you become {@condition Petrified|Ishiir} as a result of this casting of the spell, you turn back to normal after 24 hours.
You regain all expended sorcery points.
A dragon chosen and controlled by the DM appears within 5 feet of you. It is hostile to you. Good luck.

subclassFeature.name: Wild Magic Spells
entries: You learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown on the table below. Each of these spells counts as a sorcerer spell for you, but it doesn't count against the number of sorcerer spells you know.

entries.caption: Wild Spells
rows: {@spell Chaos Bolt|Ishiir}, {@spell Color Spray|Ishiir}, {@spell Dragon's Breath|Ishiir}, {@spell Nathair's Mischief|Ishiir}

subclassFeature.name: Bend Luck
entries: You have the ability to twist fate using your wild magic. When another creature you can see makes an {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}, an {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir}, or a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} and spend 1 sorcery points to roll {@dice 1d4} and apply the number rolled as a bonus or penalty (your choice) to the creature's roll. You can do so after the creature rolls but before any effects of the roll occur.

subclassFeature.name: Controlled Chaos
entries: You gain a modicum of control over the surges of your wild magic. Whenever you roll on the {@table Wild Magic Surge|PHB} table, you can roll twice and use either number.

subclassFeature.name: Master of Chaos
entries: Immediately after you cast a sorcerer spell with a spell slot, you can create an effect of your choice from the {@table Wild Magic Surge|PHB} table, provided the effect casts a spell or restores all your expended Sorcery Points.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish {@dice 1d4} {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir|Long Rests}.

subclassFeature.name: Cryomancer Spells
entries: You learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown on the table below. Each of these spells counts as a sorcerer spell for you, but it doesn't count against the number of sorcerer spells you know.

entries.caption: Cryomancer Spells
rows: {@spell Armor of Agathys|Ishiir}, {@spell Ice Knife|Ishiir}, {@spell Rime's Binding Ice|Ishiir}, {@spell Snilloc's Snowball Swarm|Ishiir}

subclassFeature.name: Clinging Frost
entries: Whenever you hit a creature with a spell of 1st level or higher that deals cold damage or it fails a save against such a spell, the magical cold you command starts clinging to it for 1 minute, reducing its {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} by 10 feet.

At the end of each of its turns, an affected creature can make a Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against your spell save DC. Each time it fails this {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, it suffers additional effects as per below. If it succeeds three times, the effect of your Clinging Frost ends on it.

items.name: One failed save:
items.entry: The affected creature cannot take {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir|Reactions}.

items.name: Two failed save:
items.entry: The affected creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} and {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|Ability Checks}.

items.name: Three failed save:
items.entry: The affected creature is {@condition Frozen|Ishiir} for 1 minute but does not have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} against cold damage caused by your spells and the effect of your Clinging Frost ends on it.

entries: This feature has no effect on creatures that cannot be {@condition Frozen|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Aegis of Rime
entries: You gain {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to cold damage.
Additionally, when you {@action Magic|Ishiir|cast a spell} of 1st level or higher that deals cold damage, you form a protective layer of magical ice on yourself.
While under this effect, the first time you take damage, that damage is reduced by an amount equal to your sorcerer level + your Charisma modifier. The effect then ends on you.

subclassFeature.name: Deep Freeze
entries: The {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} reduction from your Clinging Frost feature increases to 20 feet and subsequent failed {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} against it have additional effects as per below:

items.name: One failed save:
items.entry: The affected creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on its next {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}.

items.name: Two failed save:
items.entry: The affected creature's {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} is reduced to 0.

items.name: Three failed save:
items.entry: The affected creature has vulnerability against the damage of the next spell you cast that deals cold damage.

subclassFeature.name: Frozen Soul
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you magically transform into a creature of living ice. In this form, you have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to piercing, bludgeoning, and slashing damage as well as {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir} to cold damage and poison.

Additionally, if a creature hits you with a melee attack from within 10 ft or touches you while you are under the effect of your Aegis of Rime feature, it is immediately affected by your Clinging Frost feature. If it was already affected, it instead immediately makes a Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} as if at the end of its turn, suffering the usual effect on a failure. Succeeding on this {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} does not count towards the three successes needed to clear the effect.
Finally, creatures affected by your Clinging Frost suffer a -2 penalty to Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} against your spells that deal cold damage.
You remain in this form for 1 minute. It ends early if you are incapacitated, if you die, or if you dismiss it as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}.
You cannot use this feature again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir} or you spend 7 sorcery points to use it again.
